weather_report:
As the afternoon unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, an abundant rain graces the city under a blanket of thick, gray clouds, promising a chorus of steady drops that will soon dance upon rooftops and pavement alike. The temperature hovers around a cool 59 degrees but will gently settle closer to 56 as the day progresses, echoing the gentle, melancholic rhythm of the rain. Winds sweep in from the south, brisk and assertive at around 22 miles per hour, adding a palpable bite to the air, while the gusts intermittently swell up to 26 miles per hour, reminiscent of whispers from the Pacific. With precipitation certainty at 100%, this is no mere drizzle, but a genuine downpour, likely to yield another fraction of an inch.

As the night approaches, the rain persists, weaving a serene yet somber tapestry draped over the city. If one ventures outdoors, a waterproof jacket layered over a warm sweater would be most prudent—shielding against dampness while providing a cocoon of comfort. Tonight's low beckons with an inviting warmth of 53 degrees, a contrast to the relentless chill of the wind. The evening’s backdrop—a city cloaked in clouds—will be a perfect setting for quiet reflection. Consider a warm cup of tea at a cozy café, watching the raindrops race down the window, or perhaps find solace in a bookstore, allowing the world outside to meld into a hushed backdrop, perfect for curling up with a well-worn novel. In the heart of this rainy evening, one finds beauty in the tranquil pulse of a city that remains ever so alive beneath the rain's embrace.
